terms.definition: The individual or entity who holds legal title and full rights to a property or asset.
The official government bodies or authorized individuals who have the legal power and jurisdiction to handle a specific matter.
A phrase used in a document to establish a simpler, consistent reference for a person, entity, or object for the remainder of the text.
A legal document that officially transfers ownership of property and has been recorded with the relevant government authority.
A legal document that records the sale and transfer of ownership of an immovable property from a seller to a buyer.
Refers specifically to the property that has previously been mentioned or described within the document.
Refers to the person or people who have affixed their signature to the document.
Any legal paper used to formally move ownership, rights, or assets from one person or entity to another.
Occupying or holding property without legal permission or rightful claim.
